alert.note: Alert for Boone; Kanawha; Northwest Fayette; Northwest Raleigh; Putnam; Southeast Fayette; Southeast Raleigh; Wyoming (West Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 14 at 2:56AM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southeastern Cabell, central Kanawha, southwestern Putnam, Lincoln, Raleigh, Logan, Wyoming, Fayette and Boone Counties through 345 AM EDT... At 255 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Gauley Bridge to 7 miles west of Burnwell to Gill. Movement was southeast at 50 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Charleston, Beckley, Madison, Fayetteville, Logan, Hamlin, Pineville, Babcock State Park, South Charleston, Oak Hill, Barboursville, Montgomery, Mullens, Chesapeake, Marmet, Mount Hope, Mabscott, Ansted, Oceana and Sophia. This includes the following highways... Interstate 77 in West Virginia between mile markers 96 and 99. West Virginia Turnpike between mile markers 28 and 95. Interstate 64 in West Virginia between mile markers 120 and 137. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. To report severe weather, contact your nearest law enforcement agency. They will relay your report to the National Weather Service office in Charleston West Virginia.

area.areaDesc: Boone; Kanawha; Northwest Fayette; Northwest Raleigh; Putnam; Southeast Fayette; Southeast Raleigh; Wyoming
